decks.notes: The deck focuses on using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to remove opponent's threats, while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to pressure the opponent. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Daze and Force of Will to disrupt opponent's game plan. The mana base is heavily focused on fetching dual lands to ensure consistent mana base. Murktide Regent provides a late-game threat that can close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and disruptive, controlling the board while applying pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, utilizing cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to cheat out threats like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will helps protect the combo pieces, while cards like Brazen Borrower and Wasteland provide additional disruption and control. The goal is to quickly set up a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats before they have a chance to respond effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Faithless Looting, Entomb, and Dark Ritual, then reanimate them with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck aims to win the game by quickly bringing out big threats to overwhelm the opponent before they can effectively respond. The deck also includes cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo pieces.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Skyclave Apparition to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also using Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to quickly deploy threats like Solitude and White Orchid Phantom. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Karakas, while also generating card advantage with Yorion, Sky Nomad and Recruiter of the Guard. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield. By combining efficient removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures with evasion, the deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent quickly. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Dauthi Voidwalker to disrupt the opponent's resources, while deploying threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Barrowgoyf to close out the game swiftly. This deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. It also includes disruptive spells like Daze, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large, hard-to-answer threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also having utility creatures like Brazen Borrower and Metamorphosis Fanatic to provide additional value. This deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively through its powerful reanimation strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting opponent's mana bases by quickly ramping into powerful hate cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also deploying aggressive threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf. The goal is to lock down the opponent's ability to cast spells while applying pressure with efficient creatures and burn spells. The high density of mana acceleration allows for explosive starts, and the inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Sundering Eruption helps control the board and protect the game plan.

The deck revolves around utilizing Cephalid Illusionist's ability to quickly mill the deck, enabling Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return to win the game. It also includes various control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. Urza's Saga provides additional value by searching for key pieces, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help with consistency. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing various spells and abilities to quickly assemble a winning combo involving milling cards from the opponent's library and then winning the game through Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck includes cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual to generate mana quickly, as well as cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the opponent's library. The deck also includes protection spells like Pact of Negation and disruption spells like Cabal Therapy to help ensure the combo goes off successfully.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent, while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. It aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland, while also ensuring card advantage through cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. The inclusion of mana-fixing lands like Scalding Tarn and Misty Rainforest allows for a smooth mana base, enabling the deck to consistently apply pressure and maintain control throughout the game.
